authlogic — 2.1.6

A clean, simple, and unobtrusive ruby authentication solution.

  • Fusco says Not Working

    2 comments
    14 October, 2010

    • #ruby 1.9.1
      #rails 3.0.0.rc2
      #authlogic 2.1.6
      #bundle check ok

      ##user_sessions_controller.rb
      def create
      @user_session = UserSession.new(params[:user_session])
      if @user_session.save
      flash[:notice] = "successful"
      redirect_to root_path
      else
      flash[:notice] = "failed"
      render :action => :new
      end
      end

      my email pass is correct, but always redirected on user_sessions#new

      in log :

      DEPRECATION WARNING: Base.named_scope has been deprecated, please use Base.scope instead. (called from block in included at /var/lib/gems/1.9.1/gems/authlogic-2.1.6/lib/authlogic/acts_as_authentic/logged_in_status.rb:35)
      DEPRECATION WARNING: Base.named_scope has been deprecated, please use Base.scope instead. (called from block in included at /var/lib/gems/1.9.1/gems/authlogic-2.1.6/lib/authlogic/acts_as_authentic/logged_in_status.rb:36)

      posted by Fusco 2 days ago

    • Working !
      change
      @user_session = UserSession.new(params[:user_session])
      to
      @user_session = UserSession.new(params[:user])
      i don't know why params is modified.

      posted by Fusco 2 days ago

  • onepixelsolid says Working

    1 comment
    5 October, 2010

    • This helped me:
      gem 'authlogic', :git => 'git://github.com/odorcicd/authlogic.git', :branch => 'rails3'
      rails g authlogic:session user_session

      posted by onepixelsolid 11 days ago

  • rockrep says Not Working

    1 comment
    4 September, 2010

    • Authlogic::AuthenticatesMany not functioning per documentation at http://rdoc.info/github/binarylogic/authlogic/master/Authlogic/AuthenticatesMany. Using Rails 3.0.0.rc, Ruby 1.8.7-p174.
      NoMethodError (undefined method `delete_if' for #):
      authlogic (2.1.6) lib/authlogic/authenticates_many/base.rb:45:in `user_sessions'

      Example:
      class Company < ActiveRecord::Base
      authenticates_many :user_sessions
      has_many :users
      end
      class User < ActiveRecord::Base
      acts_as_authentic do |c|
      c.validations_scope = :company_id
      end
      belongs_to :company
      end
      class UserSession < Authlogic::Session::Base
      end
      class UserSessionsController < ApplicationController
      def create
      company = Company.find(params[:company_id])
      company.user_sessions.new(params[:user_session]) # causes NoMethodError
      ...
      end
      end

      posted by rockrep about 1 month ago

  • balexand says Not Working

    1 comment
    9 August, 2010

    • But I was able to make it work with this:

      class UserSession < Authlogic::Session::Base
      include ActiveModel::Conversion
      def persisted?
      false
      end
      end

      posted by balexand 2 months ago

    • Leave a Comment

  • Oldumy says Working

    2 comments
    8 August, 2010

    • add to to_key method in your UserSession model as follows:

      def to_key
      new_record? ? nil : [ self.send(self.class.primary_key) ]
      end

      posted by Oldumy 2 months ago

    • this works!! =)

      posted by daze21 about 1 month ago
